thread.title: Bachelorette contestant Davey Lloyd attended friends' funerals during filming
thread.title_full: Bachelorette contestant Davey Lloyd attended friends' funerals during filming

author: Ebony Bowden
title: Bachelorette contestant Davey Lloyd attended friends' funerals during filming
text:

Trailer: The Bachelorette - meet the families Sam faces an army of protective family members and their awkward questions when she embarks on hometown visits.
PT0M39S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-445jb 620 349 October 9, 2015 - 6:38AM Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings ï»¿ The Bachelorette Australia 2015: Davey evicted Bachelorette's double date difficulties Bachelorette contestant Davey Lloyd has revealed the personal pain he was hiding from Sam Frost while filming the Ten romance series.
The 25-year-old was sent home during Thursday night's episode after Frost said she didn't consider him boyfriend material.
Davey was sent home on Thursday night after Bachelorette Sam Frost said she was "confused" about who he really was. Photo: Ten 
But in an interview with The Daily Telegraph , the fun-loving carpenter revealed he left the mansion twice during filming to attend the funerals of two close friends.
Advertisement According to the report, Lloyd decided not to tell Frost about losing his two mates in the space of just one week to spare her feelings.
One funeral was for 23-year-old Lachie Thomson, who was killed in a freak accident after falling from a cliff in Sydney's Freshwater.
Davey trying to convince Sam he has a serious side. Photo: Ten 
"It was a selfless act. I didn't want to make her feel guilty. Lachie Thomson, he was a friend. I'd known him for a while," Lloyd said.
"I left the house to go to the funerals. I chose to stay because I wanted to show I was serious but I didn't want to tell her what was going on.
"I only found out because I called my mum.

"I found out four days after one had passed away, and then the next one was a few days after that."
Davey began the show well with a carnival win. 
Lloyd said he he was upset by the way he had been portrayed as "an immature brat" on the show, calling it a "joke".
He also said the comments made about him online were starting to affect him.
"It was a weird ending - they're not going to show it."
Davey interrupts alone time between Tony and Sam. 
"There's so much negativity. I can get battered down, but how much can I be humble?"
"Nobody understands what it's like unless you're in there," he said.
The NSW resident was sent home in the middle of a cocktail party by Frost without a chance to say goodbye to any of the other contestants in the house.
The Bachelorette blokes have remained close since filming wrapped several months ago, with Lloyd frequently appearing in pictures with David Billsborrow and Sasha Mielczarek.
  The 3 amigos @davey_lloyd @sash1313 
A photo posted by David Billsborrow (@billsborrow) on Sep 30, 2015 at 9:57pm PDT
